Class Entity

java.lang.Object
greenfoot.Actor
SuperSmoothMover
Entity
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Entity>
public abstract class Entity extends SuperSmoothMover implements Comparable<Entity>
Base Template for all the characters, handles attacks, stores and sorts battle field information. Borrowed Mr.Cohen's code for Image Manipulation
Version:
November 2023
Author:
Jaiden

Modified by: Dawson

    • attack

      public ArrayList<Entity> attack(Attack move, Side[] entireField)
      Based on current move, target entities and execute move to all the entities that were targeted. Current attacker goes to designated attacking slot.
      Parameters:
      move - The attack
      entireField - List that holds which side entities are on

    • changeColour

      public static void changeColour(BufferedImage bi, int addRed, int addGreen, int addBlue, int multiplier)
      Example colour altering method by Mr. Cohen. This method will increase the blue value while reducing the red and green values. Demonstrates use of packagePixel() and unpackPixel() methods.
      Parameters:
      bi - The BufferedImage (passed by reference) to change.

    • unpackPixel

      public static int[] unpackPixel(int rgbaValue)
      Takes in an rgb value - the kind that is returned from BufferedImage's getRGB() method - and returns 4 integers for easy manipulation. By Jordan Cohen Version 0.2
      Parameters:
      rgbaValue - The value of a single pixel as an integer, representing
      8 bits for red, green and blue and 8 bits for alpha:
      alpha   red     green   blue
      00000000000000000000000000000000
      Returns:
      int[4] Array containing 4 shorter ints
      0       1       2       3
      alpha   red     green   blue

    • packagePixel

      public static int packagePixel(int r, int g, int b, int a)
      Takes in a red, green, blue and alpha integer and uses bit-shifting to package all of the data into a single integer.
      Parameters:
      int - red value (0-255)
      int - green value (0-255)
      int - blue value (0-255)
      int - alpha value (0-255)
      Returns:
      int Integer representing 32 bit integer pixel ready for BufferedImage
